divs: sighting detailsmy friend rick and i were returning from a concert at kent state university westbound on the ohio turnpike(i-80) around midnight and as we were about a mile from our exit(exit 8)he called my attention to an small bright light high in the sky whose behavior was inconsistent with any normal aircraft. it would zig-zag from north to south at an impossible speed coming to a dead stop for a second or two each time it changed direction. as we exited the highway, rick shouted "it's right over the car! pull over! pull over!" i did so at a spot about halfway to the tollbooth on an incline, and we both sprang from the car leaving the doors hanging open. unbeknownst to us, right behind us was an ohio state patrolman who also immediately pulled over(probably to ask us just what in the hell we were doing). he exited his cruiser, took a step or two towards us, and then probably due to the slack-jawed look on our faces, turned around to see what we were looking at. moving west parallel to the interstate on the south side was the strangest thing i've ever seen. a large rectangular object which i would guess was about the size of a railroad boxcar was drifting along probably about 30 to 40 yards from us at an elevation just barely below level with our position on the higher embankment. it was traveling very slowly-maybe 10 to 15 mph-and was completely silent. there were a few small whiteish lights on its side allowing just enough illumination to make out its basic shape and its dark black\gray coloring. it then made a slight rumble\shudder sound followed by what sounded like a couple slight jettings of compressed air, though i couldn't pinpoint from where on the object the sounds came from. it appeared to accelerate somewhat and drifted out of view due to the adjacent terrain. the patrolman spun around and gave us each a look(i'm told i don't have a good poker face-i imagine i looked somewhat stunned-i should have!),and without saying a word to either of us, climbed into his cruiser, turned on his flashers and sped through the toll-gates. i quickly paid the toll and we tried to see which way he'd gone. rick said" it's going that way!" pointing at the south side of the split and i took that. at the time i didn't know if he meant the cruiser or whatever the hell it was we'd just seen-i just took the southbound ramp that took us towards lake avenue as fast as i could. we shot up and down lake ave. a few times trying to see it again to no avail. what we did see though was one hell of alot of cops-sheriffs, local police, and state patrol all over the place. none of them pulled us over even though we were well exceeding the speed limit(and if you knew this area, considering the time of night, that in and of itself was about as strange as whatever we'd just seen!) after about 20 to 30 minutes we gave up and headed home. was it the same object that we'd seen moving so fast overhead? who knows? it sure didn't look very aerodynamic, but i'd certainly think that it was somehow related. later in the week the local paper reported that the same and following night residents in the russia road area just southwest of there had reported strange things in the sky. i never saw anything like that again, but i'll certainly never forget it!
Summary: Rectangular boxcar sized dark object with small whiteish lights on side
